abstract.text: Starts monitoring the specified region for boundary crossings.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The region object that defines the boundary to monitor. This parameter must not be

The distance past the border (measured in meters) at which to generate notifications. You can use this value to prevent the delivery of multiple notifications when the user is close to the border’s edge.

You must call this method separately for each region you want to monitor. If an existing region with the same identifier is already being monitored by the app, the old region is replaced by the new one. The regions you add using this method are shared by all location manager objects in your app and stored in the

If you begin monitoring a region and your app is subsequently terminated, the system automatically relaunches it into the background if the region boundary is crossed. In such a case, the options dictionary passed to the
method of your app delegate contains the key

to indicate that your app was launched because of a location-related event. In addition, creating a new location manager and assigning a delegate results in the delivery of the corresponding region messages. The newly created location manager’s
property also contains the current location even if location services are not enabled.
Region events are delivered to the
methods of your delegate. If there is an error, the location manager calls the

abstract.text: Obtain the geographic location and orientation of a device.
The accuracy of a geographical coordinate.
The object you use to start and stop the delivery of location-related events to your app.
Asks the location manager to defer the delivery of location updates until the specified criteria are met.
Returns the app’s authorization status for using location services.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the device supports deferred location updates.
Cancels the deferral of location updates for this app.
The most recently retrieved user location.
The set of shared regions monitored by all location-manager objects.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether region monitoring is supported on the current device.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether region monitoring is currently enabled.
Retrieves the state of a region asynchronously.
Starts monitoring the specified region.
Starts monitoring the specified region for boundary crossings.
Starts the delivery of notifications for the specified beacon region.
Stops monitoring the specified region.
Stops the delivery of notifications for the specified beacon region.
Tells the delegate that the user entered the specified region.
Tells the delegate that the user left the specified region.
Tells the delegate that a region monitoring error occurred.
A base class representing an area that can be monitored.
A key indicating that the app was launched to handle an incoming location event.
Tells the delegate that the launch process is almost done and the app is almost ready to run.

inlineContent.text: The region object that defines the boundary to monitor. This parameter must not be

The distance past the border (measured in meters) at which to generate notifications. You can use this value to prevent the delivery of multiple notifications when the user is close to the border’s edge.
